metadata.Title: CVE-2019-18197 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In xsltCopyText in transform.c in libxslt 1.1.33, a pointer variable isn't reset under certain circumstances. If the relevant memory area happened to be freed and reused in a certain way, a bounds check could fail and memory outside a buffer could be written to, or uninitialized data could be disclosed.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-18197` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxslt1.1 - 1.1.29-5ubuntu0.2
python-libxslt1 - 1.1.29-5ubuntu0.2
xsltproc - 1.1.29-5ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libxslt package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.1.29-5ubuntu0.2').
